sections.content:
This module defines a collection of widgets that can be instantiated directly from Markdown
source when using the  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/MainModule.parseMd" semantic="function">parseMd</mkapi-api-link>  function. Widgets are referenced within  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/MainModule.GlobalMarkdownViews" semantic="class">GlobalMarkdownViews</mkapi-api-link> ,
which maps  `tag-name -> implementation`  to enable seamless integration into Markdown content.

Each widget provides a static  `fromHTMLElement`  method that specifies the attributes required for its instantiation.

## Overview

Below are examples of the available widgets. For detailed documentation on their attributes and behavior,
refer to their respective sections. Additionally, you can create custom widgets and register them globally
for your application. See the section **New Widgets** for guidance.


---

###  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/MainModule/MdWidgets.NoteView" semantic="class">NoteView</mkapi-api-link> 

<md-cell>

<note level="info">
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna
aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat.
</note>
</md-cell>

---

###  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/MainModule/MdWidgets.CodeSnippetView" semantic="class">CodeSnippetView</mkapi-api-link> 

<md-cell>
<code-snippet language="javascript" highlightedLines="8">

function compute({improbabilityFactor, babelFishCount, vogonPoetryExposure, towelAbsorbency }){
    console.log("Computation complete! The result is 42");
    const result =
        Math.log(improbabilityFactor + 42) +
        babelFishCount === 1 ? 1 : Math.sqrt(babelFishCount) +
        vogonPoetryExposure > 1000 ? -42 : vogonPoetryExposure / 100 +
        towelAbsorbency * (Math.random() + 0.42)
    return 42;
}
</code-snippet>
</md-cell>

---

###  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/MainModule/MdWidgets.CodeBadgesView" semantic="class">CodeBadgesView</mkapi-api-link> 

<md-cell>
<code-badges version="{{mkdocs-version}}" npm="mkdocs-ts" github="w3nest/mkdocs-ts" license="mit">
</code-badges>
</md-cell>

---

###  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/MainModule/MdWidgets.ExtLink" semantic="class">ExtLink</mkapi-api-link> ,  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/MainModule/MdWidgets.ApiLink" semantic="class">ApiLink</mkapi-api-link> ,  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/MainModule/MdWidgets.GitHubLink" semantic="class">GitHubLink</mkapi-api-link> ,  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/MainModule/MdWidgets.CrossLink" semantic="class">CrossLink</mkapi-api-link> ,


<md-cell>
<ext-link target="adams">D. Adams</ext-link>

<api-link target="MdWidgets"></api-link>

<cross-link target="API">API</cross-link>

<github-link target="tutorials.basics.md">GitHub page </github-link>

</md-cell>

---

## New Widgets

To extend the functionality of  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/MainModule.parseMd" semantic="function">parseMd</mkapi-api-link> , you can define and register custom widgets globally.

---

### Step 1: Define Implementation

<js-cell>
const { MkDocs, TP } = await webpm.install({
    esm:[
        'mkdocs-ts#{{mkdocs-version}} as MkDocs',
        'tweakpane#^4.0.1 as TP',
    ]
})

const customViewExample = (element) => {
    const pane = new TP.Pane()
    const getAttr = (name, defaultVal) => parseFloat(element.getAttribute(name) ?? defaultVal )
    const params = {
        improbabilityFactor: getAttr('improbabilityFactor', 3),
        babelFishCount: getAttr('babelFishCount', 1),
        vogonPoetryExposure: getAttr('vogonPoetryExposure', 250),
        towelAbsorbency: getAttr('towelAbsorbency', 2),
    };
    Object.keys(params).forEach((k) => pane.addBinding(params, k))
    pane.addButton({ title: 'Compute', label: ''}).on('click', () => computeCb(params));
    return pane.element
}
</js-cell>

---

### Step 2: Register Element

<js-cell>
MkDocs.GlobalMarkdownViews.factory = {
    ...MkDocs.GlobalMarkdownViews.factory,
    'custom-view-example' : (element) => customViewExample(element)
}
</js-cell>

See  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/MainModule.GlobalMarkdownViews" semantic="class">GlobalMarkdownViews</mkapi-api-link>  for details.

---

### Step 3: Enjoy

<md-cell>
Below is the custom view  `custom-view-example`  instantiated with  `improbabilityFactor=5` :

<custom-view-example improbabilityFactor="5.00">
</custom-view-example>
</md-cell>

code.declaration:
icons = {
    note: 'fas fa-pen-fancy',
    abstract: 'fas fa-file-alt',
    info: 'fas fa-info-circle',
    hint: 'fas fa-fire',
    success: 'fas fa-check',
    question: 'fas fa-question-circle',
    warning: 'fas fa-exclamation-triangle',
    failure: 'fas fa-times-circle',
    danger: 'fas fa-bolt',
    bug: 'fas fa-bug',
    example: 'fas fa-flask',
    quote: 'fas fa-quote-right',
}

sections.content:
Link component for referencing API entities (such as modules, classes, methods, etc):

<md-cell>
<api-link target="MdWidgets"></api-link>
</md-cell>

<note level="warning">
It requires the consumer-provided  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/MainModule/MdWidgets.ApiLink.Mapper" semantic="attribute">ApiLink.Mapper</mkapi-api-link>  implementation that resolves the  `target`  attribute
of an HTML element into a valid specification.
</note>
Icon representing API links, shown alongside the label.

Maps a string  `target`  to an object containing:
-  `href` : the relative URL fragment in the form e.g.  `@nav/api/foo.bar` .
-  `withClass` : a semantic CSS class such as  `mkapi-role-function` ,  `mkapi-role-method` , etc.
-  `withStyle`  (optional): additional inline styles.

This should be implemented by the consumer of the class.

Creates the view from a given HTML element.
The element should include a  `target`  attribute used to resolve link details via the mapper.

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content: *  **elem**: The original HTMLElement parsed from Markdown or the DOM.

sections.title: Returns
sections.content: A  `BaseLink`  instance representing the rendered VirtualDOM anchor tag.

Represents usual code badges view (NPM, PyPI, GitHub, ...).

This view is registered in  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/MainModule.GlobalMarkdownViews" semantic="class">GlobalMarkdownViews</mkapi-api-link> : it can be instantiated from Markdown with an HTMLElement
using the tag  `code-badge` , see  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/MainModule/MdWidgets.CodeBadgesView.fromHTMLElement" semantic="method">CodeBadgesView.fromHTMLElement</mkapi-api-link> .

## Examples

<md-cell>
<code-badges version="{{mkdocs-version}}" npm="mkdocs-ts" github="w3nest/mkdocs-ts" license="mit">
</code-badges>
</md-cell>
Children of the element.
The class associated with the element, equivalent to the  `className`  property of  `HTMLElement` .

code.declaration: public readonly class = `${CodeBadgesView.CssSelector} d-flex align-items-center flex-wrap`

sections.content: The tag of the element, equivalent to the  `tagName`  property of  `HTMLElement` .
Component's class name for CSS query.
Initializes a new instance.

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content:
*  **github**: Github target, if not provided the associated badge is not displayed.
The final url is  `https://github.com/${github}` .
*  **license**: License badge (only 'MIT' supported), if not provided the associated badge is not displayed.
*  **npm**: NPM target, if not provided the associated badge is not displayed.
The final url is  `https://npmjs.com/package/${npm}` .
*  **pypi**: Pypi target, if not provided the associated badge is not displayed.
The final url is  `https://pypi.org/project/${pypi}` .
*  **version**: Version bookmark, if not provided the associated badge is not displayed.
Attributes mapper from an  `HTMLElement`  to the arguments of the class's constructor.

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content: *  **element**: The  `HTMLElement` .

code.declaration:
static attributeMapper = (element: HTMLElement) => ({
        license: element.getAttribute('license') ?? undefined,
        version: element.getAttribute('version') ?? undefined,
        npm: element.getAttribute('npm') ?? undefined,
        pypi: element.getAttribute('pypi') ?? undefined,
        github: element.getAttribute('github') ?? undefined,
    })

sections.content:
Construct an instance of NoteView from an  `HTMLElement` .

See  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/MainModule/MdWidgets.CodeBadgesView.attributeMapper" semantic="method">CodeBadgesView.attributeMapper</mkapi-api-link>  for details on the attributes conversion from the  `HTMLElement` .

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content: *  **element**: The  `HTMLElement` .

code.implementation:
export class CodeBadgesView implements VirtualDOM<'div'> {
    /**
     * Component's class name for CSS query.
     */
    static readonly CssSelector = 'mkdocs-CodeBadgesView'

    public readonly tag = 'div'
    public readonly class = `${CodeBadgesView.CssSelector} d-flex align-items-center flex-wrap`
    public readonly children: ChildrenLike

    /**
     * Attributes mapper from an `HTMLElement` to the arguments of the class's constructor.
     *
     * @param element The `HTMLElement`.
     */
    static attributeMapper = (element: HTMLElement) => ({
        license: element.getAttribute('license') ?? undefined,
        version: element.getAttribute('version') ?? undefined,
        npm: element.getAttribute('npm') ?? undefined,
        pypi: element.getAttribute('pypi') ?? undefined,
        github: element.getAttribute('github') ?? undefined,
    })

    /**
     * Construct an instance of NoteView from an `HTMLElement`.
     *
     * See {@link CodeBadgesView.attributeMapper} for details on the attributes conversion from the `HTMLElement`.
     *
     * @param element The `HTMLElement`.
     */
    static fromHTMLElement(element: HTMLElement) {
        return new CodeBadgesView({
            ...CodeBadgesView.attributeMapper(element),
        })
    }

    /**
     * Initializes a new instance.
     *
     * @param _args The arguments.
     * @param _args.github Github target, if not provided the associated badge is not displayed.
     * The final url is `https://github.com/${github}`.
     * @param _args.npm NPM target, if not provided the associated badge is not displayed.
     * The final url is `https://npmjs.com/package/${npm}`.
     * @param _args.pypi Pypi target, if not provided the associated badge is not displayed.
     * The final url is `https://pypi.org/project/${pypi}`.
     * @param _args.version Version bookmark, if not provided the associated badge is not displayed.
     * @param _args.license License badge (only 'MIT' supported), if not provided the associated badge is not displayed.
     */
    constructor({
        github,
        npm,
        pypi,
        version,
        license,
    }: {
        github?: string
        npm?: string
        pypi?: string
        version?: string
        license?: string
    }) {
        this.children = [
            version ? new VersionBadge({ version }) : undefined,
            github
                ? new BadgeView({
                      name: 'Github Sources',
                      filename: 'github.svg',
                      href: `https://github.com/${github}`,
                  })
                : undefined,
            npm
                ? new BadgeView({
                      name: 'Package',
                      filename: 'npm.svg',
                      href: `https://npmjs.com/package/${npm}`,
                  })
                : undefined,
            pypi
                ? new BadgeView({
                      name: 'Package',
                      filename: 'pypi.svg',
                      href: `https://pypi.org/project/${pypi}`,
                  })
                : undefined,
            license && license === 'mit'
                ? new BadgeView({
                      name: 'MIT',
                      filename: 'mit.svg',
                      href: `https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MIT_License`,
                  })
                : undefined,
        ]
    }
}

sections.content:
Represents a code snippet view. This view is registered in GlobalMarkdownViews : it can be instantiated from Markdown with an HTMLElement using the tag `code-snippet` , see CodeSnippetView.fromHTMLElement . ## Examples function compute({improbabilityFactor, babelFishCount, vogonPoetryExposure, towelAbsorbency }){ console.log("Computation complete! The result is 42"); const result = Math.log(improbabilityFactor + 42) + babelFishCount === 1 ? 1 : Math.sqrt(babelFishCount) + vogonPoetryExposure > 1000 ? -42 : vogonPoetryExposure / 100 + towelAbsorbency * (Math.random() + 0.42) return 42; } def compute(improbabilityFactor, babelFishCount, vogonPoetryExposure, towelAbsorbency ): print("Computation complete! The result is 42"); const result = Math.log(improbabilityFactor + 42) + babelFishCount === 1 ? 1 : Math.sqrt(babelFishCount) + vogonPoetryExposure > 1000 ? -42 : vogonPoetryExposure / 100 + towelAbsorbency * (Math.random() + 0.42) return 42; Ultimate Computation

Ultimate Computation Example

Provide your parameters and compute the result!





 3 1 250 2 42 Computation complete! The result is always 42, but you knew that already. .computation-container { display: flex; flex-direction: column; align-items: center; justify-content: center; font-family: 'Courier New', Courier, monospace; background-color: #f0f8ff; border: 2px dashed #42a5f5; padding: 20px; margin: 20px; border-radius: 8px; box-shadow: 0 4px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); } computation: improbabilityFactor: 3 # A number too high might summon a whale and a bowl of petunias. babelFishCount: 1 # Keep it to one, unless you enjoy linguistic chaos. vogonPoetryExposure: 250 # Measured in verses endured. 1000+ is not recommended. towelAbsorbency: 2 # Towel quality. Higher is better for intergalactic travel. ## Computation Here is a summary of the parameters: - improbabilityFactor: 3 - babelFishCount: 1 - vogonPoetryExposure: 250 - towelAbsorbency: 2
The children of the associated HTML element.
The class list of the associated HTML element.

code.declaration: public readonly class = `mkdocs-CodeSnippetView w-100 overflow-auto mb-3 mkdocs-resize-observer`

sections.content: The code mirror configuration.
The style of the associated HTML element.
The tag of the associated HTML element.
Component's class name for CSS query.
Class appended to the line DOM for highlighted lines.
Initialize the widget.

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content:
*  **cmConfig**: The code mirror editor configuration, it is merged with the
     <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/MainModule/MdWidgets.CodeSnippetView.codeMirrorConfiguration" semantic="attribute">default configuration</mkapi-api-link>  (eventually overriding attributes).
*  **content**: The snippet's content.
*  **highlightedLines**: Highlighted lines, *e.g.*  `[5 10 20-25  28 30]`
*  **language**: The target language. Supported languages are:
     *  python
     *  javascript
     *  markdown
     *  html
     *  yaml
     *  css
     *  xml
Attributes mapper from an  `HTMLElement`  to the arguments of the class's constructor.

Link component for cross-links:

<md-cell>
<cross-link target="API">API</cross-link>
</md-cell>

<note level="warning">
It requires the consumer-provided  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/MainModule/MdWidgets.CrossLink.Mapper" semantic="attribute">CrossLink.Mapper</mkapi-api-link>  implementation that resolves the  `target`  attribute
of an HTML element into a valid specification.
</note>
Icon representing cross links, shown alongside the label.

Maps a string  `target`  to an object containing:
-  `href` : the relative URL fragment in the form e.g.  `@nav/tuto/getting-started` .
-  `withClass`  (optional): a CSS class to apply for custom styling.
-  `withStyle`  (optional): additional inline styles.

This should be implemented by the consumer of the class.

Creates the view from a given HTML element.
The element should include a  `target`  attribute used to resolve link details via the mapper.

<ext-link target="adams">D. Adams</ext-link>
</md-cell>


<note level="warning">

of an HTML element into a valid specification.
</note>

Maps a string  `target`  to an object containing:
-  `href` : an absolute URL (e.g.,  `https://example.com` )
-  `withClass`  (optional): a CSS class to apply for custom styling.
-  `withStyle`  (optional): inline styles to apply to the link.

This should be implemented by the consumer of the class.
Constructor from HTML element as defined in the Markdown source.

of an HTML element into a valid specification.
</note>

-  `href` : an absolute URL to a GitHub resource.
-  `withClass`  (optional): a CSS class to apply for custom styling.
-  `withStyle`  (optional): inline styles to apply to the link.

This should be implemented by the consumer of the class.

Creates the view from a given HTML element.
The element should include a  `target`  attribute used to resolve link details via the mapper.

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content: *  **elem**: The original HTMLElement parsed from Markdown or the DOM.

sections.title: Returns
sections.content: A  `BaseLink`  instance representing the rendered VirtualDOM anchor tag.

Base class for rendering a hyperlink ( `<a>` ) VirtualDOM element with text & icon.
This uses the  `target`  attribute from the provided DOM element along with the provided mapping function
to resolve link information and generate text & icon.
Children of the element.

Returns the hyperlink's URL.

Can be set, to change the URL.

[MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/HTMLAnchorElement/href)
The tag of the element, equivalent to the  `tagName`  property of  `HTMLElement` .

Sets or retrieves the window or frame at which to target content.

[MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/HTMLAnchorElement/target)
Create an hyperlink from a corresponding HTMLElement in Markdown.

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content:
*  **classPrefix**: Class prefix to always include.
*  **elem**: The source HTML element containing a  `target`  attribute.
*  **icon**: An icon to render before or after the label.
*  **mapper**: A function that maps the target string to  `href` ,  `withClass` , and  `withStyle` .
*  **newTab**: Whether to open the link in a new tab.

Represents a note.

This view is registered in  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/MainModule.GlobalMarkdownViews" semantic="class">GlobalMarkdownViews</mkapi-api-link> : it can be instantiated from Markdown with an HTMLElement
using the tag  `note` , see  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/MainModule/MdWidgets.NoteView.fromHTMLElement" semantic="method">NoteView.fromHTMLElement</mkapi-api-link> .

## Examples

### Basics

A note is defined providing a  `level`  attribute and a text content:

<md-cell>
<note level='info'>
This is a note with no option beside  `level` .
</note>
</md-cell>

Available levels are defined by  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/MainModule/MdWidgets.NoteLevel" semantic="type-alias">NoteLevel</mkapi-api-link>  and illustrated in section **Available Levels**.

There are multiple options that can be provided, *e.g.*

<md-cell>
<note level='info' icon='fas fa-star' title='Custom label' expandable='true'>
This is a note with multiple options defined:
*   `icon` : Overrides the default icon for the level.
*   `title` : Overrides the default title for the level.
*   `expandable` : Makes the note expandable.

<note level="hint">
The additional option  `mode`  is available for expandable notes.
</note>
</note>
</md-cell>

See  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/MainModule/MdWidgets.NoteView.attributeMapper" semantic="method">NoteView.attributeMapper</mkapi-api-link>  for the list of available options.

### Available Levels

<js-cell>
const { MkDocs } = await webpm.install({
    esm:['mkdocs-ts#{{mkdocs-version}} as MkDocs']
})
const src =  `
<note level="{{level}}">
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna
aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat.
</note> ` 

const levels = ['note', 'abstract', 'info', 'hint', 'success', 'question',
                'warning', 'failure', 'danger', 'bug', 'example', 'quote']

levels.forEach((level)=> {
    display(MkDocs.parseMd({src:src.replace('{{level}}', level)}))
})
</js-cell>
Children of the element.
The class associated with the element, equivalent to the  `className`  property of  `HTMLElement` .

code.declaration: public readonly class: string = `${NoteView.CssSelector} border rounded text-justify`

sections.content: Lifecycle hook called just after the element has been attached to the document's DOM.
The tag of the element, equivalent to the  `tagName`  property of  `HTMLElement` .
Component's class name for CSS query.
Attributes mapper from an  `HTMLElement`  to the arguments of the class's constructor.

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content: *  **element**: The  `HTMLElement` .

code.declaration:
static attributeMapper = (element: HTMLElement) => ({
        level: element.getAttribute('level') as NoteLevel,
        label:
            element.getAttribute('title') ??
            element.getAttribute('label') ??
            undefined,
        content: element.textContent ?? '',
        expandable: element.getAttribute('expandable')
            ? element.getAttribute('expandable') === 'true'
            : false,
        mode:
            (element.getAttribute('mode') as ExpandableMode | null) ??
            'stateless',
        icon: element.getAttribute('icon') ?? undefined,
    })

Languages supported.

Relevant for expandable note only.
If  `stateful` , the note will preserve its state upon collapse/expand,
otherwise the content is removed on collapse and regenerated on expand (effectively deleting the state).

A function that maps a string target (link identifier) to
href, optional CSS class, and optional style attributes.

The  `elem`  argument is the  `HTMLElement`  as defined in the Markdown content.

sections.content:
Represents a trait for elements using the 'mkdocs-resize-observer' class.
Extends  `DOMTrait`  to ensure the class name is present and includes a method to refresh the view.
Refreshes all element annotated with  <mkapi-api-link nav="@nav/api/MainModule/MdWidgets.ResizeObserverTrait" semantic="type-alias">ResizeObserverTrait</mkapi-api-link>  within a given HTML element.

sections.title: Arguments
sections.content: *  **elem**: The parent HTML element to search for resize observers.
Represents a DOM trait where a specific class name must be included within the class attribute.
